title: Why do people never take Japanese Massacres in World War II into account? - Quora
tags: Military History and Wars of Japan

response.answer_text: 1: It happened in China, which is in Asia. Which is neither the US or Europe. As such, in true human fashion, since the West did not have a vested interest in the region at the time, events happening there went unnoticed. Frankly, this is still a problem in the US education system, but that is a story for another time. 2: We weren’t their foes long enough, and allies with the Chinese long enough, for it to come to a head. The Germans, frankly, picked a fight with everyone, and so everyone had a bone to pick with them on their… policies. the USSR was similar, in that we had a half century long silent feud, so any dirt that could be dished was worth dishing. China, meanwhile, rather quickly changed sides to the communists after the dust settled. 3: Japan hasn’t really brought it up much. Unlike Germany, who has taken full responsibility for their actions, to the point that even Israel has grudging respect for them, Japan hasn’t fully admitted to the extent of the warcrimes. This in particular has created severe friction between China, Korea, and Japan in recent years.
